intro: Restio strobilifer, commonly known as the African restio, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a perennial grass-like plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing small, inconspicuous flowers that are often wind-pollinated. Restio strobilifer plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
